definition: the act of moving a load by drawing or pulling, engage somebody to enter the army
details:
noun
- the act of moving a load by drawing or pulling
= synonyms: draught, drawing
- a large and hurried swallow
= synonyms: draught, gulp, swig
- compulsory military service
= synonyms: conscription, muster, selective service
- a dose of liquid medicine
= example: a dose of liquid medicine
= synonyms: draught
- a preliminary sketch of a design or picture
= synonyms: rough drawing
- a regulator for controlling the flow of air in a fireplace
- the depth of a vessel's keel below the surface (especially when loaded)
= synonyms: draught
- any of the various versions in the development of a written work
= example: any of the various versions in the development of a written work
= synonyms: draft copy
- a serving of drink (usually alcoholic) drawn from a keg
= example: a serving of drink (usually alcoholic) drawn from a keg
= synonyms: draught
- a current of air (usually coming into a chimney or room or vehicle)
= synonyms: draught
- a document ordering the payment of money
= synonyms: bill of exchange, order of payment
verb
- engage somebody to enter the army
= synonyms: enlist, muster in
- make a blueprint of
= synonyms: draught, blueprint
- draw up an outline or sketch for something
= example: draw up an outline or sketch for something
= synonyms: outline
